Reporting¶

API Documentation¶

This module integrating generation model based report into pdf format into django admin. Currently there are 2 available engine we use to generate pdf file.

  1. ReportLab using *.rml file for layouting template.
  2. WeasyPrint using *.html.

Utils¶

You can use utilities in this module to generate pdf report (e.g, using it to make custom action in admin class)

RML2PDF¶

class django_reporting.utils.RML2PDF(context, template_name=None, output=None)¶

ReportLab wrapper class to generate pdf report with *.rml template file

Attributes

RML2PDF.template_name = None¶

html template name used to render the report

RML2PDF.context = None¶

context object used by render() function

RML2PDF.output¶

pdf output filename, default to default.pdf

Method

RML2PDF.get_template()¶

get template file

Returns:template
RML2PDF.get_context_data()¶

get context data

Returns:context
RML2PDF.render()¶

render pdf report data

Returns:HttpResponse

HTML2PDF¶

class django_reporting.utils.HTML2PDF(context, template_name=None, output=None)¶

WeasyPrint wrapper class to generate pdf report with *.html template file

Attributes

HTML2PDF.template_name = None¶

html template name used to render the report

HTML2PDF.context = None¶

context object used by render() function

HTML2PDF.output¶

pdf output filename, default to default.pdf

Method

HTML2PDF.get_template()¶

get template file

Returns:template
HTML2PDF.get_context_data()¶

get context data

Returns:context
HTML2PDF.render(request)¶

render pdf report data

Returns:HttpResponse

Mixin¶

HTMLModelReportMixin¶

class django_reporting.admin.HTMLModelReportMixin¶

Model mixin with WeasyPrint engine.

Mixin for django admin to generate model object detail in pdf format report with WeasyPrint using html file template.

Attributes

HTMLModelReportMixin.report_template = None¶

String path of html file template to be used for rendering the report

HTMLModelReportMixin.report_context_object_name = None¶

String, object context used in rendered template

HTMLModelReportMixin.report_output = None¶

String report output file type, default to pdf format

HTMLModelReportMixin.change_form_template = 'admin/django_reporting/change_form_report.html'¶

Methods

HTMLModelReportMixin.get_urls()¶

Get default django admin urls then add custom url for report link

Returns:urlpattern
HTMLModelReportMixin.get_context_data(obj)¶

Get context data to used in template, should return django Context objects

HTMLModelReportMixin.get_report_template()¶

Get report template, used by render() function to render the report should return html template file

HTMLModelReportMixin.get_output_filename()¶

Get report ouput filename when rendering report output

HTMLModelReportMixin.report(request, object_id, extra_context=None)¶

View used to ouputs the report

Parameters:
  • = django HttpRequest object (request) –
  • = django models object id (object_id) –
  • extra_context –
Returns:
Return type:

report = Reporting objects extending django HttpResponse

RMLModelReportMixin¶

class django_reporting.admin.RMLModelReportMixin¶

Model mixin with ReportLab engine.

Mixin for django admin to generate model object detail in pdf format report with ReportLab *.rml template.

Attributes

RMLModelReportMixin.report_template = None¶

String path of html file template to be used for rendering the report

RMLModelReportMixin.report_context_object_name = None¶

String, object context used in rendered template

RMLModelReportMixin.report_output = None¶

String report output file type, default to pdf format

RMLModelReportMixin.change_form_template = 'admin/django_reporting/change_form_report.html'¶

Methods

RMLModelReportMixin.get_urls()¶

Get default django admin urls then add custom url for report link

Returns:urlpattern
RMLModelReportMixin.get_context_data(obj)¶

Get context data to used in template, should return django Context objects

RMLModelReportMixin.get_report_template()¶

Get report template, used by render() function to render the report should return html template file

RMLModelReportMixin.get_output_filename()¶

Get report ouput filename when rendering report output
